error.cannot_connect: Could not connect to the charging station.
error.unknown: Unkown error occured. Please check the logs.
error.no_device_found: No device was found in your network.

data.rfid_class: RFID class for default authentication (color code, optional)

deprecated_yaml.description:
Your existing YAML configuration has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the keba YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

Due to internal restructuring, you may need to update automations, scripts and your dashboard.
deprecated_yaml.title: YAML configuring of Keba is no longer used.

start.name: Authorize charging process
start.description: Authorizes a charging process with the given RFID tag.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

rfid.name: RFID Tag
rfid.description: The RFID tag to authorize the charging process (must be configured in the charging station first).

rfid_class.name: RFID Class
rfid_class.description: RFID class to be used (RFID color code)

stop.name: Deauthorize charging process
stop.description: Deauthorizes the running charging process with the given RFID tag.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

rfid.name: RFID Tag
rfid.description: The RFID tag to authorize the charging process (must be configured in the charging station first).

set_energy.name: Set energy limit
set_energy.description: Sets the energy target after which the charging process stops.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

energy.name: Energy Limit
energy.description: The energy target to stop charging in kWh. Setting 0 disables the limit.

set_current.name: Set current limit
set_current.description: Sets the maximum current for charging processes.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

current.name: Current Limit
current.description: The maximum current used for the charging process. The value is limited by the DIP-switch settings and the used cable of the charging station.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: The delay in seconds after which the defined current should be set.

set_failsafe.name: Set failsafe
set_failsafe.description: Set the failsafe mode of the charging station. If all parameters are 0, the failsafe mode will be disabled.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

timeout.name: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout after which the failsafe mode is triggered, if set_current was not executed during this time.

fallback_value.name: Fallback value
fallback_value.description: Fallback current to be set after timeout.

persist.name: Persist
persist.description: If failsafe_persist is False, the failsafe option is only used until charging station reboot. If failsafe_persist is True, the failsafe option will survive a reboot.

set_charging_power.name: Set charging power
set_charging_power.description: Set the charging power in kW if a charging operation is running. This service internally identifies the number of phases used for charging and sets the charging charging current to match the charging power as good as possible.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

round_up.name: Round up charging power
round_up.description: The charging station only supports to set current on all three phases. When round_up is enabled, the charging current will round up so that at least the given charging power is reached. Otherwise it is rounded down, so that less than the given charging power is reached.

stop_below_6_ampere.name: Stop charging below 6A
stop_below_6_ampere.description: If enabled, the charging process will stop if given charging power is too small. Otherwise, charging will continue with 6 A per phase.

set_output.name: Set output
set_output.description: Output opens and closes the relay terminal X2. X2 is located in the connection panel of the charging station. The reply TCH-OK confirms only the receiving of the command and not the correctness of the value. Values between 2 and 9 are not being replied to (reserved functions). Invalid values (e.g. letters) are leading to a deactivation of the relay. The correct reception can be verified in the Output sensor. This command needs DSW1.2 to be set to OFF.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

out.name: Output value on X2
out.description: 0 is open, 1 is close, 2-9 not allowed (reserved functions), >= 10 Pulse output with the specified number of pulses (pulses / kWh) and is stored in the EEPROM; reasonably usable up to 150.

x2src.name: Set X2 source
x2src.description: Sets the X2 swtich source which specifies the communication channel used for toggle the contact x2

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

source.name: Communication channel
source.description: Source for X2 output switching. 0 No phase toggle source is available, 1 Toggle via OCPP, 2 Direct toggle command via RESTAPI, 3 Toggle via Modbus, 4 Toggle via UDP.

x2.name: X2 Phase switch
x2.description: Sets th external phase switch via contact x2. When switching between the parameters, a cool down time of 5 minutes is required.

device_id.name: Charging Station
device_id.description: The Keba Charging Station to run the service on.

three_phases.name: Three phases
three_phases.description: True for using all three phases, False for using only one phase.
